body:
In all other uses of stacks, the assumption is that the stack can hold more inputs that what the operator will consume. Here it is adding a strong assumption that the stack only contains the inputs for this executor. It would be safer if we only examined the top N elements as determined by the graph. 

We do not want to guarantee that the stack has to be empty except for the current arguments, because it precludes a lot of stack movement optimizations.
